verses.kjv: And Jacob dwelt in the land wherein his father was a stranger, in the land of Canaan.
verses.ct: Jacob settled in the land of Canaan, where his father had lived as a foreigner.

verses.kjv: These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brethren; and the lad was with the sons of Bilhah, and with the sons of Zilpah, his father’s wives: and Joseph brought unto his father their evil report.
verses.ct: This is the account of Jacob's family. Joseph was seventeen years old and was tending the flocks alongside his brothers, working with the sons of Bilhah and the sons of Zilpah, who were his father's wives. Joseph reported their bad behavior to his father.

verses.kjv: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his children, because he was the son of his old age: and he made him a coat of many colours.
verses.ct: Israel loved Joseph more than any of his other children because Joseph had been born to him in his old age. He made him a coat of many colours.

verses.kjv: And when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren, they hated him, and could not speak peaceably unto him.
verses.ct: When his brothers realized that their father loved Joseph more than all of them, they hated him and were unable to say a kind word to him.

verses.kjv: And Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it his brethren: and they hated him yet the more.
verses.ct: Joseph had a dream, and when he shared it with his brothers, their hatred for him grew even deeper.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Hear, I pray you, this dream which I have dreamed:
verses.ct: He said to them, "Please listen to this dream I had."

verses.kjv: For, behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and, lo, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and, behold, your sheaves stood round about, and made obeisance to my sheaf.
verses.ct: "We were tying bundles of grain together out in the field, and suddenly my bundle stood up straight. Then your bundles gathered around mine and bowed down to it."

verses.kjv: And his brethren said to him, Shalt thou indeed reign over us? or shalt thou indeed have dominion over us? And they hated him yet the more for his dreams, and for his words.
verses.ct: His brothers responded, "Do you actually think you will rule over us? Do you really believe you will have authority over us?" So they hated him even more because of his dreams and what he said.

verses.kjv: And he dreamed yet another dream, and told it his brethren, and said, Behold, I have dreamed a dream more; and, behold, the sun and the moon and the eleven stars made obeisance to me.
verses.ct: Then he had yet another dream and told his brothers about it. He said, "Listen, I had another dream. This time the sun, the moon, and eleven stars were bowing down to me."

verses.kjv: And he told it to his father, and to his brethren: and his father rebuked him, and said unto him, What is this dream that thou hast dreamed? Shall I and thy mother and thy brethren indeed come to bow down ourselves to thee to the earth?
verses.ct: When he shared this with his father and his brothers, his father scolded him, saying, "What kind of dream is this? Are your mother and I and your brothers really going to come and bow to the ground before you?"

verses.kjv: And his brethren envied him; but his father observed the saying.
verses.ct: His brothers were jealous of him, but his father kept the matter in mind.

verses.kjv: And his brethren went to feed their father’s flock in Shechem.
verses.ct: His brothers traveled to Shechem to tend their father's flocks.

verses.kjv: And Israel said unto Joseph, Do not thy brethren feed the flock in Shechem? come, and I will send thee unto them. And he said to him, Here am I.
verses.ct: Israel said to Joseph, "Your brothers are grazing the flocks near Shechem. I want to send you to them." Joseph replied, "I am ready."

verses.kjv: And he said to him, Go, I pray thee, see whether it be well with thy brethren, and well with the flocks; and bring me word again. So he sent him out of the vale of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.
verses.ct: Israel told him, "Go and check on your brothers and see how the flocks are doing, then come back and let me know." So he sent Joseph from the valley of Hebron, and he traveled to Shechem.

verses.kjv: And a certain man found him, and, behold, he was wandering in the field: and the man asked him, saying, What seekest thou?
verses.ct: A man came across Joseph wandering through the fields and asked him, "What are you looking for?"

verses.kjv: And he said, I seek my brethren: tell me, I pray thee, where they feed their flocks.
verses.ct: Joseph answered, "I am trying to find my brothers. Please tell me where they are pasturing their flocks."

verses.kjv: And the man said, They are departed hence; for I heard them say, Let us go to Dothan. And Joseph went after his brethren, and found them in Dothan.
verses.ct: The man said, "They have already left this place. I overheard them say, 'Let us head to Dothan.'" So Joseph followed after his brothers and found them at Dothan.

verses.kjv: And when they saw him afar off, even before he came near unto them, they conspired against him to slay him.
verses.ct: They spotted him from a distance, and before he reached them, they plotted to kill him.

verses.kjv: And they said one to another, Behold, this dreamer cometh.
verses.ct: They said to each other, "Look, here comes that dreamer."

verses.kjv: Come now therefore, and let us slay him, and cast him into some pit, and we will say, Some evil beast hath devoured him: and we shall see what will become of his dreams.
verses.ct: "Let's kill him now and throw his body into one of these pits. We can say that a wild animal ate him. Then we will see what comes of his dreams."

verses.kjv: And Reuben heard it, and he delivered him out of their hands; and said, Let us not kill him.
verses.ct: Reuben heard this and rescued Joseph from their plan, saying, "We must not take his life."

verses.kjv: And Reuben said unto them, Shed no blood, but cast him into this pit that is in the wilderness, and lay no hand upon him; that he might rid him out of their hands, to deliver him to his father again.
verses.ct: Reuben told them, "Do not spill any blood. Just throw him into this pit here in the wilderness, but do not lay a hand on him." He said this intending to rescue Joseph later and return him safely to their father.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Joseph was come unto his brethren, that they stript Joseph out of his coat, his coat of many colours that was on him;
verses.ct: When Joseph arrived where his brothers were, they stripped him of his coat — the coat of many colours he was wearing.

verses.kjv: And they took him, and cast him into a pit: and the pit was empty, there was no water in it.
verses.ct: They grabbed him and threw him into a pit. The pit was empty and dry, with no water in it.

verses.kjv: And they sat down to eat bread: and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and, behold, a company of Ishmeelites came from Gilead with their camels bearing spicery and balm and myrrh, going to carry it down to Egypt.
verses.ct: Then they sat down to eat a meal. Looking up, they noticed a caravan of Ishmeelites approaching from Gilead. Their camels were loaded with spicery, balm, and myrrh, and they were heading down to Egypt.

verses.kjv: And Judah said unto his brethren, What profit is it if we slay our brother, and conceal his blood?
verses.ct: Judah said to his brothers, "What do we gain by killing our brother and covering up his death?"

verses.kjv: Come, and let us sell him to the Ishmeelites, and let not our hand be upon him; for he is our brother and our flesh. And his brethren were content.
verses.ct: "Let's sell him to the Ishmeelites instead and not harm him ourselves, since he is our own brother, our own flesh." His brothers agreed.

verses.kjv: Then there passed by Midianites merchantmen; and they drew and lifted up Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmeelites for twenty pieces of silver: and they brought Joseph into Egypt.
verses.ct: When Midianite traders came by, the brothers pulled Joseph up out of the pit and sold him to the Ishmeelites for twenty pieces of silver. The Ishmeelites took Joseph to Egypt.

verses.kjv: And Reuben returned unto the pit; and, behold, Joseph was not in the pit; and he rent his clothes.
verses.ct: When Reuben went back to the pit, Joseph was gone. He tore his clothes in anguish.

verses.kjv: And he returned unto his brethren, and said, The child is not; and I, whither shall I go?
verses.ct: He went back to his brothers and cried out, "The boy is gone! Where can I turn now?"

verses.kjv: And they took Joseph’s coat, and killed a kid of the goats, and dipped the coat in the blood;
verses.ct: They took Joseph's coat, slaughtered a young goat, and soaked the coat in its blood.

verses.kjv: And they sent the coat of many colours, and they brought it to their father; and said, This have we found: know now whether it be thy son’s coat or no.
verses.ct: They brought the coat of many colours to their father and said, "We found this. Examine it and determine whether or not it belongs to your son."

verses.kjv: And he knew it, and said, It is my son’s coat; an evil beast hath devoured him; Joseph is without doubt rent in pieces.
verses.ct: He recognized it immediately and said, "This is my son's coat! A wild animal has eaten him! Joseph has surely been torn to pieces!"

verses.kjv: And Jacob rent his clothes, and put sackcloth upon his loins, and mourned for his son many days.
verses.ct: Jacob tore his clothes, wrapped himself in sackcloth, and grieved for his son for a long time.

verses.kjv: And all his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted; and he said, For I will go down into the grave unto my son mourning. Thus his father wept for him.
verses.ct: All his sons and daughters tried to console him, but he would not be consoled. He said, "I will go down to the grave still mourning for my son." So his father continued to weep for him.

verses.kjv: And the Midianites sold him into Egypt unto Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh’s, and captain of the guard.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the Midianites sold Joseph in Egypt to Potiphar, one of Pharaoh's officials and the captain of the guard.
